reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My business colleagues and I stopped here on our way back from Obergurgl for two nights in March 2011. While this hotel was very pretty and reasonably priced if sharing with three people, I cannot say it was my favorite hotel I've ever stayed in. The location was so-so.... it was a good 10-20 minute walk from anything to do (there are some small shops and bakeries 10 minutes away, and old town is about a 20 minute walk). The elevator and hallways were impossibly small for luggage unless you had just a carry-on bag. Wi-fi was only available in the lobby but you had to get a password from the front desk that expired every 15 minutes, which was completely unreasonable if you ask me. One of our two nights, the bartender and another person who worked at the hotel got into a fist-fight. While I recognize that it is Europe and rooms are small, this room seemed VERY small and the beds were VERY uncomfortable compared to other places I've stayed in Europe. Overall, I think while it was clean and pretty and the bar was nice (save the fighting staff), one could probably find better options for the same price. I do highly recommend Salzburg, though. Gorgeous city.
reviews.title: Good hotel if you like soft beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was plain (nothing on the walls) and drab, although clean. Housekeeping service was fine but otherwise, service left much to be desired. There was often no one at the front desk, although they would generally show up in a few minutes; but by then, there might be several people waiting for service. In addition, I sent laundry out; when, two days later, it still hadn't shown up, I called to find out what had happened. I was informed that my laundry was still at the front desk as it hadn't been turned in early enough to go out Friday morning, and Saturday, Sunday and Monday were holidays. There was no explanation why the laundry hadn't been returned to me, or why I hadn't at least been notified my laundry was still sitting there. For the money we paid, this hotel was definitely not worth the price.
reviews.title: Poor service, drab room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My sister and her husband, my brother and his wife and I recently stayed at the NH Hoteles in Salzburg. I am handicapped, so we requested a handicap accessible room for me when we made reservations. The hotel was honest that my room was not a full-up accessible room, so I knew what to expect. There were grab bars by the toilet and in the tub/shower and that was it. The room was nice, but really too cramped for either a power chair or a wheelchair, but for one night it was okay.
